intro: Eulalia gracillima, commonly known as the slender grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its delicate, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. Eulalia gracillima typically thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
